content.webTitle: Best pictures of the day - live

fields.headline: Best pictures of the day - live
fields.bodyText: Today's Picture from the Past is of Basil Rathbone who became the definitive Sherlock Holmes in the 1940s having played Arthur Conan Doyle's character in 14 Hollywood films. Click here to enlarge. And for a more modern take on Sherlock you can read Lucy Mangan's review of last night's Sherlock Dakar rally 2014: The competition is gruelling event covering thousands of kilometres through some epic locations Chile, Argentina and Bolivia. We look back at the first week in our gallery Our photographer Murdo MacLeod took today's Eyewitness photograph of a dead sperm whale washed up on a Scottish beach. We asked him how he took it: I used long lens with a 1.4x converter to bring the beach, which was almost a mile away, into the background. And I also used a clothes peg for my nose! Murdo also added his own pro tip: When perched on a rock surrounded by the sea - when you crouch down to take a picture - do not have your iphone in your long raincoat front pocket - as it will be swimming with the fishes Monday roundup: Here are some of the best galleries from the weekend that you might have missed
